Posts.Content: wife and I spent 6 hours at MD Anderson. I was really blown away by the Mays Clinic, it felt like a 5 star hotel w/o a pool. Everyone was caring and wonderful. Dr John Davis has done 1900 RALPH's. they set up great personal website for all my info, reports, Dr notes ect.... Had blood test at 4pm and results (7.80) were posted to my site by 6pm. I know I am in the right place and look forward to being cancer free. Surgery July 28th then a month long easy recovery on the beach in Watercolor fl.... 5/9/14 pathology DRE normal biopsy 7/12 cores positive 6 gleason 3-3 1 gleason 3-4 psa 7.4 64%,31%,19%,7%,14%,13%20% core involvement surgery date July 28th 2014
Posts.Title: meet my team at MD Anderson elected RALPH July 28th

Posts.Content: Thanks chuck....read many of your posts your insight is awesome dude
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed but staying positive

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Mikla Hi Fastball, You have a very good chance of getting successful treatment. Did your doc feel anything when (s)he did a DRE? Take some time and do the research on various treatments (different types of radiation and surgery). Based on your stats, treatment is in order. Did the report say that they found cancer on both sides of the prostate? This and the previous question help determine the stage. Feel free to ask away with any specific questions and someone will certainly respond. Good Luck and keep us updated! Report stated all quadrants were positive for cancer. Im not knowledgeable enough to know if there was cancer on both sides. Did have ct scan which was negative, cystscopy to check bladder which was clean and urine cytology that came back atypical. Urologist wanted to do biopsy because dre was fine
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed but staying positive

Posts.Content: going to MD Anderson for plan of action in 3 days, rcd pathology report yesterday.. wife really upset but I have been her rock and will continue to be...gotta stay positive dob-1958 psa 14.8 7 out of 12 cores positive 2 cores 3+4 gleason cores 64%,31%,19%, 7%,14%,13%, 20% No stage given on report any advice would be awesome....
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed but staying positive

Posts.Content: Md anderson asked for urologist and pathology info so they can look at slides. Seems like things are moving in right direction. Just a little shocked to come home from sunbelt baseball tournamen( son plays for texas state) and get hit with sledge hammer. Im a little clueless and overwhelmed and im gonna slow the train down to get all the info i can. Ordered walsh's book 2 copies for myself and wife
